column6: Could make or break your marriage :)
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2021
column14: I got two for my cars. Just plugged them in, stuck in 32gig micro sd cards, and they turn on every time the car is on. Very easy setup and it's just a matter of removing the sd card and copying it on my laptop, if I ever want to review a video. I found the controls and the tiny screen very cumbersome for any kind of viewing, but I wasn't expecting much from a $30 cam. The video quality is great for what it's supposed to do, just don't expect a cinematic experience. I suggest that you take the sd card out after first use, and check the videos just to make sure the cam is working properly. 32gig card seems to save about an hour and a half of video.

column6: Pretty Inexpensive option which works to my need!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2021
column14: I have been thinking about getting a dashcam for my son's Toyota car since I have been concerned for the road safety. I had looked around and found some pretty expensive options, all over 100$ range before stumbling upon this product. Have been using for this a little over a week now and am completely satisfied with what this has to offer.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021
column14: I like this camera because it’s small but the screen is still large enough to be useful. It has a bunch of neat features and the menu isn’t too complicated. It’s easy to lock a video clip so it won’t be erased by the loop.

column6: Better than last one I got

column14: First let me say that you should get the 180 degree vs the 170 or 175 fish eye. The extra degrees makes for a better view of the side of road.

column6: Great dash cam at a great price.

column14: Great picture and the suction cup holds great. If it loses grip just dampen it before locking to the windshield.

column6: This is great Dashboard camera. Would recommended.

column14: Pretty good quality dash cam for the price. Obviously, a dash cam at this price would not have that. There is an option to add a rear-facing cam, through the AV jack. Overall, I am definitely happy with this dash cam.

column6: Works well for a low priced dash cam
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
column14: These dash cams are a must for any car or truck on the road. A dash can recently helped solve a hit and run on my car. Insurance stated if it wasn't for the dash cam, it would be hard to find the driver and collect for the damage. Dash read the license plate; Police tracked down the driver as well as Insurance Co. Paid nothing to have car fixed.
